# biometryType

**Instance Property**

The type of biometric authentication supported by the device.

## Declaration

```swift
var biometryType: LABiometryType { get }
```

## Discussion

Use the value of this property to ensure that any authentication-related user prompts you create match the biometric capabilities of the device. For example, if the value of this property is [doc://com.apple.localauthentication/documentation/LocalAuthentication/LABiometryType/faceID], don’t refer to Touch ID in an authentication prompt.

This property is set only after you call the [doc://com.apple.localauthentication/documentation/LocalAuthentication/LAContext/canEvaluatePolicy(_:error:)] method, and is set no matter what the call returns. The default value is [doc://com.apple.localauthentication/documentation/LocalAuthentication/LABiometryType/none].

## Checking availability

- **canEvaluatePolicy(_:error:)**: Assesses whether authentication can proceed for a given policy.
- **LAPolicy**: The set of available local authentication policies.
- **LABiometryType**: The set of available biometric authentication types.
